New Records: Alek Thomas became the ninth player in MLB history with a game-tying, pinch-hit home run in the eighth inning or later of a postseason game. He is the youngest player ever to do it.
Key Match Events: Thomas hit a home run in the bottom of the eighth inning, tying the game and sending the Diamondbacks into the thick of the NLCS.
Gabriel Moreno singled home a run in the third and eighth innings, giving the Diamondbacks a 6-5 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Torey Lovullo was thinking of pulling Thomas back and using Jordan Lawlar as a pinch hitter instead to lay down a sacrifice bunt if Longoria's at-bat was successful.
Post-Match Reflections: Alek Thomas said, 'That play is definitely something that you see in your dreams. For it to come in real life and for it to happen to me is just awesome. I'm so grateful to have that moment. It's just unreal. Just crazy. I haven't really processed it yet, but it was awesome.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks' bullpen devolved into chaos after Thomas hit the home run.
Thomas is one of 10 players on the Diamondbacks' playoff roster who spent considerable time in the minors during the regular season.
